list.abs: The opportunity is apropos when , can create , good luck is good circumstances , can not create ., 机会是恰好的时候 , 可以创造 , 机遇则是好的境遇 , 不可以创造.

You speak quite apropos ., 你说话很恰当.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent.: from French à propos ('with regard) to (this) purpose'

entry.def: Something which is apropos, or apropos of, a subject or event, is connected with it or relevant to it.

example.ex: All my suggestions apropos the script were accepted...
example.tran: 我所有有关该剧本的建议均被采纳了。

example.ex: George Orwell once asked, apropos of publishers, 'Why don't they just say,  “We don't want your poems”?'
example.tran: 乔治·奥威尔一次提及出版商时曾问道：“为什么他们不干脆说，‘我们不想要你的诗作’？”

entry.def: Apropos or apropos of is used to introduce something that you are going to say which is related to the subject you have just been talking about.

example.ex: Apropos Dudley Moore living in California he said, 'He loves the space, Californians have a lot of space.'
example.tran: 提到住在加利福尼亚的达德利·穆尔，他说：“他喜欢开阔，加利福尼亚人的生活空间非常开阔。”

entry.def: Something that is apropos is very suitable in a particular situation.

example.ex: It was a verse from the book of Job. It was so apropos.
example.tran: 这是摘自乔布书中的一句诗，用得非常恰当。

means.word_mean: 1. of an appropriate or pertinent nature

sentences.sentence: "apropos, can you lend me some money for the weekend?"
